class.name: PlaneShape4D
class.brief_description: A 4D plane physics shape with a 3D surface.
class.description: PlaneShape4D describes a 4D plane physics shape with a 3D surface. It can be used to create world boundaries, such as an infinite floor or infinite walls. Planes may only be used with non-moving [StaticBody4D] or [Area4D] nodes, and cannot be used with moving bodies. For simplicity, the plane always has its normal vector pointing in the local +Y direction, and always intersects the local origin. This means the plane has no properties. The plane is infinite in the local X, Z, and W directions. To make a finite plane instead of an infinite one, use a [BoxShape4D] shape instead. To change the position or rotation of the plane, move or rotate the [CollisionShape4D] node the plane is attached to.
